dunit.toolkit

Assert toolkit for more expressive unit testing.

Many methods implement compile-time parameters (file, line) that are set at the call site. It is preferred that these parameters are ignored when using these methods.

License

MIT. See LICENSE.txt for full details.

void assertEqual(A, B)(A value, B target, string message = "Failed asserting equal", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that two values are equal.

Parameters

value The value used during the assertion.
target The target value.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

123.assertEqual(123);
"hello".assertEqual("hello");

void assertHasKey(A, B)(A[B] haystack, B needle, string message = "Failed asserting array has key", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that an associative array contains a particular key.

Parameters

haystack The associative array to interogate.
needle The key the array should contain.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

["foo":1, "bar":2, "baz":3, "qux":4].assertHasKey("foo");
[1:"foo", 2:"bar", 3:"baz", 4:"qux"].assertHasKey(1);

void assertHasValue(A)(A[] haystack, A needle, string message = "Failed asserting array has value", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that an array contains a particular value.

Parameters

haystack The array to interogate.
needle The value the array should contain.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

[1, 2, 3, 4].assertHasValue(2);
["foo", "bar", "baz", "qux"].assertHasValue("foo");
[["foo", "bar"], ["baz", "qux"]].assertHasValue(["foo", "bar"]);

void assertCount(A)(A[] array, ulong count, string message = "Failed asserting array count", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that an array contains a particular value count.

Parameters

array The array to interogate.
count The amount of values the array should hold.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

[1, 2, 3, 4].assertCount(4);
["foo", "bar", "baz", "qux"].assertCount(4);
[["foo", "bar"], ["baz", "qux"]].assertCount(2);

void assertEmpty(A)(A[] array, string message = "Failed asserting empty array", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that an array is empty.

Parameters

array The array to interogate.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

[].assertEmpty();

void assertFalse(T)(T value, string message = "Failed asserting false", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a boolean value is false.

Parameters

value The value used during the assertion.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

false.assertFalse();

void assertFalsey(T)(T value, string message = "Failed asserting falsey", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a value evaluates as false.

Parameters

value The value used during the assertion.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

false.assertFalsey();
[].assertFalsey();
null.assertFalsey();
0.assertFalsey();

void assertTrue(T)(T value, string message = "Failed asserting false", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a boolean value is true.

Parameters

value The value used during the assertion.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

true.assertTrue();

void assertTruthy(T)(T value, string message = "Failed asserting true", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a value evaluates as true.

Parameters

value The value used during the assertion.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

true.assertTruthy();
["foo"].assertTruthy();
1.assertTruthy();

void assertType(A, B)(B value, string message = "Failed asserting type", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a value is of a particular type.

Parameters

value The value used during the assertion.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

1.assertType!(int)();
"foo".assertType!(string)();
["bar"].assertType!(string[])();
['a'].assertType!(char[])();

void assertGreaterThan(A, B)(A value, B threshold, string message = "Failed asserting greater than", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a value is greater than a threshold value.

Parameters

value The value used during the assertion.
threshold The threshold value.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

11.assertGreaterThan(10);

void assertGreaterThanOrEqual(A, B)(A value, B threshold, string message = "Failed asserting greater than or equal", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a value is greater than or equal to a threshold value.

Parameters

value The value used during the assertion.
threshold The threshold value.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

10.assertGreaterThanOrEqual(10);
11.assertGreaterThanOrEqual(10);

void assertLessThan(A, B)(A value, B threshold, string message = "Failed asserting less than", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a value is less than a threshold value.

Parameters

value The value used during the assertion.
threshold The threshold value.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

9.assertLessThan(10);

void assertLessThanOrEqual(A, B)(A value, B threshold, string message = "Failed asserting less than or equal", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a value is less than or equal to a threshold value.

Parameters

value The value used during the assertion.
threshold The threshold value.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

10.assertLessThanOrEqual(10);
9.assertLessThanOrEqual(10);

void assertNull(A)(A value, string message = "Failed asserting null", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a value is null.

Parameters

value The value to assert as null.
message The error message to display.
file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

class T {}

string foo;
int[] bar;
T t;

foo.assertNull();
bar.assertNull();
t.assertNull();
null.assertNull();

void assertMatchRegex(string value, string pattern, string message = "Failed asserting match to regex", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a string matches a regular expression.

Parameters

string value The value used during the assertion.
string pattern The regular expression pattern.
string message The error message to display.
string file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
ulong line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

"foo".assertMatchRegex(r"^foo$");
"192.168.0.1".assertMatchRegex(r"((?:[\d]{1,3}\.){3}[\d]{1,3})");

void assertStartsWith(string value, string prefix, string message = "Failed asserting starts with", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a string starts with a particular string.

Parameters

string value The value used during the assertion.
string prefix The prefix to match.
string message The error message to display.
string file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
ulong line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

"foo bar".assertStartsWith("foo");
"baz qux".assertStartsWith("baz");

void assertEndsWith(string value, string suffix, string message = "Failed asserting ends with", string file = __FILE__, ulong line = __LINE__);

Assert that a string ends with a particular string.

Parameters

string value The value used during the assertion.
string suffix The suffix to match.
string message The error message to display.
string file The file name where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.
ulong line The line where the error occurred. The value is added automatically at the call site.

Examples

A simple example. 

"foo bar".assertEndsWith("bar");
"baz qux".assertEndsWith("qux");
